5NB.DU.summary: Novetum AG provides various financial and capital markets consultancy services, primarily related to structuring, organization, and implementation of financing. It offers equity financing, debt financing, and hybrid financing, such as convertible bonds; and strategy and business development advisory services. The company is based in Frankfurt, Germany. Novetum AG is a subsidiary of PVM Private Values Media AG.

BBHK.F.summary: Deutsche Balaton AG is a private equity focusing on private equity investments in listed and unlisted companies, real estate investments and investments in other assets. It will consider investing in any industry, although the company tends to invest in manufacturing, investment and service industries. Deutsche Balaton tends to invest in both German and Hungarian companies. Main exit strategies are IPO or trade sale. The firm was founded in 1991 and is based in Heidelberg, Germany.

BFV.F.summary: Berliner Effektengesellschaft AG, through its subsidiaries, provides various banking and financial products and services in Germany. The company offers a range of services in the capital markets, including financial advisory/listings, concept development, implementation of IPOs and listing, preparation and implementation of private placements, capital structuring and execution, structured finance, reverse merger transactions, and transaction support services. It also provides securities trading and venture capital services; and private banking services, including private and company pension planning, financial planning, and portfolio optimization, as well as digital insurance services. The company was formerly known as Berliner Freiverkehr (Aktien) GmbH and changed its name to Berliner Effektengesellschaft AG in 1999. Berliner Effektengesellschaft AG was founded in 1986 and is based in Berlin, Germany.

BWB.DE.summary: Baader Bank Aktiengesellschaft, an investment bank, trades in financial instruments in Europe and internationally. The company trades in equities, bonds, funds and exchange traded funds, and securitized derivatives; and engages in the over-the-counter trading activities. It also provides electronic trading services, including automated order execution in shares, bonds, ETPs, and derivatives for clients on the national and international stock exchanges and trading platforms; and sales trading/execution services, such as the receipt and execution of client orders and orders of the bank's own clients, as well as flow and news management, portfolio trading, trading strategy advice, sponsoring, CSA and prime brokerage, and clearing services, as well as sells research products and trading ideas. In addition, the company offers capital market services, such as advice in financing and capital market transactions; structuring and execution of equity or debt transactions; reallocations of stocks; project financing; and technical trading services comparing support for capital measures, capital increases, and decreases, as well as for the purchase of shares, squeeze-out procedures, and withdrawal of invalid physical share certificates. Further, it provides banking services that include account and custody account management, fund-based savings plans, securities and derivatives trading in accounts, custody accounts, and execution of orders, as well as other banking-related services and trade/order entry applications. Additionally, the company engages in the portfolio management of fund products, including UCITS and special funds, offshore funds, and derivative overlay mandates; and equity research activities. The company was founded in 1983 and is headquartered in Unterschleissheim, Germany. Baader Bank Aktiengesellschaft is a subsidiary of Baader Beteiligungs GmbH.

BWB.F.summary: Baader Bank Aktiengesellschaft, an investment bank, trades in financial instruments in Europe and internationally. The company trades in equities, bonds, funds and exchange traded funds, and securitized derivatives; and engages in the over-the-counter trading activities. It also provides electronic trading services, including automated order execution in shares, bonds, ETPs, and derivatives for clients on the national and international stock exchanges and trading platforms; and sales trading/execution services, such as the receipt and execution of client orders and orders of the bank's own clients, as well as flow and news management, portfolio trading, trading strategy advice, sponsoring, CSA and prime brokerage, and clearing services, as well as sells research products and trading ideas. In addition, the company offers capital market services, such as advice in financing and capital market transactions; structuring and execution of equity or debt transactions; reallocations of stocks; project financing; and technical trading services comparing support for capital measures, capital increases, and decreases, as well as for the purchase of shares, squeeze-out procedures, and withdrawal of invalid physical share certificates. Further, it provides banking services that include account and custody account management, fund-based savings plans, securities and derivatives trading in accounts, custody accounts, and execution of orders, as well as other banking-related services and trade/order entry applications. Additionally, the company engages in the portfolio management of fund products, including UCITS and special funds, offshore funds, and derivative overlay mandates; and equity research activities. The company was founded in 1983 and is headquartered in Unterschleissheim, Germany. Baader Bank Aktiengesellschaft is a subsidiary of Baader Beteiligungs GmbH.

DFTK.DE.summary: DF Deutsche Forfait AG, a forfaiting company, provides foreign trade finance and related services for exporters, importers, and other financial companies worldwide. It is involved in the collection of foreign trade receivables; and provision of marketing and consulting services. The company also engages in granting of loans, purchase and sale of promissory notes, processing of payment transactions, and debt collection activities. In addition, the company offers project financing and factoring services, as well as professional support for structuring of transactions or formulation of payment instruments. DF Deutsche Forfait AG was founded in 2000 and is headquartered in Gruenwald, Germany.

DFTK.F.summary: DF Deutsche Forfait AG, a forfaiting company, provides foreign trade finance and related services for exporters, importers, and other financial companies worldwide. It is involved in the collection of foreign trade receivables; and provision of marketing and consulting services. The company also engages in granting of loans, purchase and sale of promissory notes, processing of payment transactions, and debt collection activities. In addition, the company offers project financing and factoring services, as well as professional support for structuring of transactions or formulation of payment instruments. DF Deutsche Forfait AG was founded in 2000 and is headquartered in Gruenwald, Germany.

DG6.HM.summary: DG-Gruppe AG provides occupational pension, clearing house, and charge optimization related consulting services in Germany. It also offers training programs. The company was founded in 2003 and is based in Wemding, Germany.

FNG.F.summary: Fritz Nols AG provides capital market consulting services for small size companies in Germany. The company was founded in 1975 and is based in Berlin, Germany.

FTK.DE.summary: flatexDEGIRO AG provides solutions and services in the areas of finance and financial technology for financial service providers in Europe. It operates through Financial Services (FIN) and Technologies (TECH) segments. The FIN segment offers business-to-consumer online brokerage, business-to-business white-label banking, electronic securities settlement, brokerage account management, and other banking products and services. This segment also provides capital markets and securities custody platforms; outsourcing solutions; technical transaction processing services; cash management and payments services; and secured lending services, as well as engages in treasury and investment activities. The TECH segment is involved in the development, production, distribution, and maintenance of software, hardware, and information technology infrastructure. This segment also provides a platform for private and specialist banks; corporate payment products; and develops and operates Limit Order System, which monitors the limit orders of European brokers against the price feed of connected issuers. The company was formerly known as flatex AG and changed its name to flatexDEGIRO AG in October 2020. flatexDEGIRO AG is headquartered in Frankfurt am Main, Germany. flatex AG is a subsidiary of GfBk Gesellschaft fÃ¼r BÃ¶rsenkommunikation mbH.

It operates through Financial Services (FIN) and Technologies (TECH) segments. The FIN segment offers business-to-consumer online brokerage, business-to-business white-label banking, electronic securities settlement, brokerage account management, and other banking products and services. The company was formerly known as flatex AG and changed its name to flatexDEGIRO AG in October 2020. flatexDEGIRO AG is headquartered in Frankfurt am Main, Germany. flatex AG is a subsidiary of GfBk Gesellschaft fÃ¼r BÃ¶rsenkommunikation mbH.

GBQ.HM.summary: GBK Beteiligungen AG is a private equity firm specializing in later stage, middle market, management buyouts, ownership buyouts, management buy-ins, spin offs as well as expansion financing, succession, emerging growth and bridge financing. The firm typically co-invests alongside its cooperation partner Hannover Finanz GmbH. It invests in all industries with a focus on production, trade and service companies. The firm prefers to invest in Germany, Austria, and Switzerland. It typically invests a minimum of Â3 million ($3.37 million) in companies with maximum enterprise values of Â150 million ($168.56 million) and an annual turnover of at least Â20 million ($22.47 million). GBK prefers to take a minority equity stake in the transaction it participates. The firm has an average holding period of eight years. GBK Beteiligungen AG was founded in 1969 and is based in Hannover, Germany.

GBQ.SG.summary: GBK Beteiligungen AG is a private equity firm specializing in later stage, middle market, management buyouts, ownership buyouts, management buy-ins, spin offs as well as expansion financing, succession, emerging growth and bridge financing. The firm typically co-invests alongside its cooperation partner Hannover Finanz GmbH. It invests in all industries with a focus on production, trade and service companies. The firm prefers to invest in Germany, Austria, and Switzerland. GBK prefers to take a minority equity stake in the transaction it participates. The firm has an average holding period of eight years. GBK Beteiligungen AG was founded in 1969 and is based in Hannover, Germany.

GOZ2.F.summary: Gold-Zack AG is a European investment group for small- and medium-sized companies in growth markets. Gold-Zack was formerly an Internet service provider, but the company has changed its focus towards the investment market. Services provided by the Gold-Zack group cover the value creation chain for the growing enterprise. The company also deals with start-up financing and consulting; all the way to the initial public offering and comprehensive services for publicly traded companies. In these areas Gold-Zack focuses especially on the sectors of the future: e-Business, Telecommunications, Media, Sport, Entertainment and Life Sciences/Biotechnology. The company is based in Mettmann, Germany. As of October 1, 2003 Gold-Zack AG is in liquidation.

LUS.DE.summary: Lang & Schwarz Aktiengesellschaft, through its subsidiaries, engages in the development and issuance of derivative financial instruments in Germany. The company operates a platform for OTC trading that trades in stocks, funds, bonds, and ETPs; LS Exchange, an electronic trading system; and IT hardware and software services. Lang & Schwarz Aktiengesellschaft was founded in 1996 and is headquartered in DÃ¼sseldorf, Germany.

LUS.F.summary: Lang & Schwarz Aktiengesellschaft, through its subsidiaries, engages in the development and issuance of derivative financial instruments in Germany. The company operates a platform for OTC trading that trades in stocks, funds, bonds, and ETPs; LS Exchange, an electronic trading system; and IT hardware and software services. Lang & Schwarz Aktiengesellschaft was founded in 1996 and is headquartered in DÃ¼sseldorf, Germany.

MONV.SG.summary: Bloxolid GmbH offers blockchain platform for cryptocurrency trading. The company was founded in 2018 and is based in Isernhagen, Germany.

MWB.DE.summary: mwb fairtrade Wertpapierhandelsbank AG operates as a securities trading company in Germany. It provides order books for German and international securities, including equities, fixed income securities, and open-ended investment funds. The company also offers capital market services, such as serving institutional investors, executing equities and fixed income orders for institutional market participants, and designated sponsoring for selected equities. In addition, it provides issuance consulting and listings, designated sponsoring, debt and equity capital markets, institutional client, and order execution services. The company was founded in 1993 and is based in GrÃ¤felfing, Germany.

It provides order books for German and international securities, including equities, fixed income securities, and open-ended investment funds. The company also offers capital market services, such as serving institutional investors, executing equities and fixed income orders for institutional market participants, and designated sponsoring for selected equities. In addition, it provides issuance consulting and listings, designated sponsoring, debt and equity capital markets, institutional client, and order execution services. NF4.F.summary: Netfonds AG provides advisory services. It offers legal and regulatory services in investment fund, insurance, pension, and financing product categories. The company is based in Hamburg, Germany.

O4B.DE.summary: OVB Holding AG provides financial advisory services primarily to private households in Europe. The company principally engages in the provision of advisory to its clients in structuring their finances; and broking various financial products offered by insurance companies, banks, building societies, and other enterprises. OVB Holding AG was founded in 1970 and is headquartered in Cologne, Germany.

P0E.MU.summary: vPE WertpapierhandelsBank AG provides brokerage services. It offers investment and private banking solutions, crypto trading, and family office. The company also provides advisory solutions, online trading, and asset management services. It serves individual, institutional, and professional customers, as well as medium-sized companies. The company was founded in 1989 and is headquartered in Munich, Germany.

SGU.F.summary: Sino-German United AG operates a trading and service company in Germany and the People's Republic of China. The company was founded in 2016 and is based in Munich, Germany.

VEH.F.summary: Valora Effekten Handel AG operates as a securities trading company in Germany. The company was founded in 1988 and is based in Ettlingen, Germany.

WSO1.DE.summary: wallstreet:online AG operates wallstreet-online.de, a financial portal in Germany. The company's portal offers information on the topics of stock market, economy, and finance. It provides national and international market price data, charts, and insider data, as well as financial and analytical tools in the area of stock exchange and markets. The company was founded in 1998 and is based in Berlin, Germany.

WSO1.F.summary: wallstreet:online AG operates wallstreet-online.de, a financial portal in Germany. The company's portal offers information on the topics of stock market, economy, and finance. It provides national and international market price data, charts, and insider data, as well as financial and analytical tools in the area of stock exchange and markets. The company was founded in 1998 and is based in Berlin, Germany.

XTP.F.summary: Sino AG provides online stock exchange trading services in Germany. The company offers trading platforms, such as sino MX-PRO that provides access to approximately 40 exchanges and 10 direct trading partners. The company was formerly known as sino Wertpapierhandelsgesellschaft mbH. Sino AG was founded in 1998 and is based in DÃ¼sseldorf, Germany.
